snippet: It would be tragic if Egyptians allowed the 2011 revolution to end with this rejection of democracy.
abstract: Editorial maintains Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi's overthrow by the military was unquestionably a coup; stresses how profoundly important it is that Egyptians avoid violence that could plunge country into civil war; praises Pres Obama for reacting with appropriate caution to Morsi's ouster.
lead_paragraph: It would be tragic if Egyptians allowed the 2011 revolution to end with this rejection of democracy.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
